definition: to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
to cut off (a length)/to stop/to intercept/section/chunk/length

sentences.english: In the basketball match he can block.
Terry blocked well and gave confidence to the under-fire Ferdinand.
sentences.chinese: 特里的阻截非常好，给压力下的费迪南德带来了信心。

sentences.english: And his shirt is on the ground while he's tackled by police.
sentences.chinese: 当他被警察阻截的时候他把衬衣仍在了地上。

sentences.english: It is extremely hard to tackle from behind without infringing one of these statements.
sentences.chinese: 不违反这些规定的从背后阻截是非常非常难得。

sentences.english: However, performing a legal tackle like this is exceptionally difficult.
sentences.chinese: 但是，像这样制造一个合法的阻截是异常困难的。

sentences.english: Mark was given a yellow card for an aggressive tackle in the first half.
sentences.chinese: 马克在上半场因为挑衅的阻截动作而被判黄牌警告。

sentences.english: He tackled hard in the game.
The Laws do not specifically outlaw tackling from behind.
sentences.chinese: 规则并没有明确从背后阻截是犯规。

definition: to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
raid/to carry out a raid/to invade
attack from two sides/pincer movement/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to encircle and annihilate/refers to repeated campaigns of the Guomindang against the communists from 1930 onwards
